clinical_study.brief_title: A Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Trial of Donepezil Adjunctive Treatment for Cognitive Impairment in Schizophrenia
clinical_study.official_title: Donepezil Adjunctive Treatment for Cognitive Impairment in Schizophrenia

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study was to study the effects of donepezil on cognition in patients with schizophrenia. The investigators conducted a 12-week, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of donepezil as adjunctive treatment to antipsychotic drugs on patients with schizophrenia.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators conducted a 12-week, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial of donepezil as adjunctive treatment to antipsychotic drugs on patients with schizophrenia.The trial will be complete in 2012.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in the Composite Score From the Cognition Assessment Battery After 12 Weeks of Treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Cognition Assessment scores After 12 Weeks of Treatment

arm_group.description: Subjects will be given with a dose of 5mg/day placebo. All drugs will be administered orally.
Subjects will be given with a dose of 5 mg/day donepezil. All drugs will be administered orally.
